corsace-closed-2024-1.title: Corsace Manga
corsace-closed-2024-1.description: A creative manga project to promote an online gaming tournament and build a fanbase.
corsace-closed-2024-1.personalThoughts: This project was what made me realize I wanted to join the New Media program. It taught me what taking initiative could do, it taught me that I could make things a reality if I put my mind to it. Our work got 3rd place in Namicomi and watching the community's reaction was incredibly humbling. We sold out books instantly and recently did a reprint this year that also instantly sold out!

details.goal: To launch a creative project to promote an online gaming tournament and build a fanbase

planning.description: Started when I caught wind of Bae and Brandon joking about making a manga while I was social media manager. I was already working with Julia on character design for our tournament promotion. Knowing Bae's artistic talent and Brandon's management skills, I approached them to make it reality.
points: Spent a week on logistics (timeframe, topic, publishing, workload)
Acted as product owner and company voice
Ensured script aligned with company goals and character design philosophies
Used Clip Paint Studio for storyboarding and GIMP for rough panel editing

scriptwriting.description: Focused on keeping artists happy by preserving their ideas while steering away from excessive workload.
points: Worked through 3 script versions with editing and proofreading in Google Docs
Chose themes of change, staff turnover, and finding purpose
Represented the harsh realities of running a gaming company in the osu! sphere

storyboarding.description: Collaborated heavily with all artists on visual planning.
points: Drew rough panels and crude sketches with motion arrows and emotion notes
Built actual sets in Minecraft for team participation and agreement
Ensured everyone could visualize and agree on story locations

drawing.description: Was scrum master during production - kept everyone on track.
points: Checked in with artists every other day
Always available for input and help when needed
Proofread and QA'd pages while being made to save time later

publishing.description: Looked into how to actually get this thing published online.
points: Hit up MangaDex first, they sent me to Namicomi
Got everything ready for when tournament launched
Tournament offered physical books - jumped on that opportunity
Did book typography in Photoshop

details.outcome: Community reception was amazing; it was an awesome experience as people contacting from all over the gaming scene to congratulate us and say how much they appreciated it. The books were sold at a gaming event and sold instantly, which we were ecstatic about. It also got 3rd in Namicomi's popularity of the month which earned us a free Japanese translation. This project is what made me decide to join this program.

corsace-closed-2024-2.title: Mountain Bike Commercial
corsace-closed-2024-2.description: A promotional commercial for a fictitious mountain bike company using provided footage and self-produced video.
corsace-closed-2024-2.personalThoughts: This was my first real dive into video production. Playing the role of a professional dirt biker while playing a persona was a humourous (especially to my partners) and enjoyable moment. This project is what lead me towards video production and storytelling. Our professor said it was the best project he had ever seen, which made me tear up a bit.

details.goal: Produce a commercial for a fictitious company using a mixture of provided footage and self-produced video to advertise and promote the brand

planning.description: Team brainstormed our fake company brand and how to show it in the commercial.
points: Reviewed provided footage and decided on cool, laidback, fun tone
Wanted to stay professional but not stuffy
Brand personality should come through naturally

preparation.description: Figured out our main goals for the commercial.
points: Keep viewer entertained throughout
Leave an impact that sticks
Company personality understood without being obvious
Semi-casual raw interview for authenticity

filming.description: Set up proper lighting and filmed the interview segments.
points: Three-point lighting setup with dressed actor
I played professional dirt biker being interviewed
Character was laid-back and cool to match brand
All answers improvised for authentic feel

editing.description: Used Premiere Pro to combine action shots with interview.
points: Interlaced action footage with interview segments
Applied color correction for consistent look
Created dynamic transitions between scenes
Aligned cuts with music timing for good pacing

refinement.description: Finished with logo creation and final touches.
points: Made company logo with clean italicized font and speed lines
Added glitch effect transition between logo and website
Matched gritty nature of the mountain bike footage

actions.task: Brainstorm talking points, writing interview prompts
Set up and film all video footage, acting as interviewer
Creating logo and adding company information

details.outcome: The commercial successfully displayed personality and the editing paired with music created an entertaining video spectacle that left an impact on the class. Feedback noted the filmed audio had an echoey feel due to the shotgun mic used.

video-storytelling-project-b-3.title: Travel Commercial
video-storytelling-project-b-3.description: A commercial for a fictitious travel company focusing on narrative advertising and meaningful human connections.
video-storytelling-project-b-3.personalThoughts: This project pushed our production group to the limit, taking multiple shots and days to record only a few mintues of actual footage. It was a bit more serious in nature which was a new challenge in itself. We went from cool in the motorcycle commercial to now sentimental and empathic.

details.goal: To create a commercial for a fictitious travel company

planning.description: We were tasked with creating a storyboard for a commercial that advertised a fake company that we created earlier in the term. The company that we chose to work for was a travel agency. As it was a storytelling class, we felt it was appropriate to focus on narrative advertising.
points: Focused on wholesome and heartfelt tone to leave lasting impression
Considered logistics: feasibility, technical requirements, locations, audio and pacing
Developed story about two artists supporting each other through social media
Showcased travel company's mission: To create meaningful connections with one another

characterDevelopment.description: Had to make two distinct characters that felt real.
points: Made one extroverted photographer, other introverted painter new to social media
Focused on body language and clothing to show personalities
Used different shot types for each character
Planned mood lighting to match their emotions

storyboarding.description: Drew the storyboard once we had our plan figured out.
points: I handled the second half of scenes using Clip Paint Studio
Captured expressions and tracked movement with arrows
Black arrows for character movement, red for camera movement
Labeled everything so it was easy to read

scripting.description: Made a proper script with shot list after storyboard got approved.
points: Continuity was huge - wanted to show friendship developing over time
Characters change outfits between scenes
Shot at different times of day to show time passing
Detailed shot list to prep for filming

shooting.description: I was cameraman for most shoots, directed the shots.
points: Used rule of thirds and got diverse range of shots
Split filming into 3 days: inside, outdoors, pickup shots
Wireless lavalier mics for intimate narration feel
Lots of material to work with in editing

editing.description: Started editing after first two days of shooting.
points: Put footage together in Premiere Pro following storyboard
I did clip cutting and pacing adjustments
Too many scenes for 5-minute limit
Had to scrap scenes and cut stuff that ran too long

afterEffects.description: Learned After Effects and went back to improve text stuff.
points: Replaced Premiere text Mogrts with After Effects for more control
Made custom textbox component with pen tool
Animated with motion blur, keyframes and opacity
Added tracking with Null boxes and dynamic scaling with source code

actions.task: Character designs, shot list, dialogue, updated planning sheet

details.outcome: It was well received! I think we did a great job aligning the tone of the commercial with the wholesome message of the company which was to connect others. If there was one thing I would have liked to fix in the future it would have been to also implement color correction into the footage as I feel it would further enhance the color mood themes we hid within the commercial.

corsace-rebrand-2025.title: Corsace Rebrand 2025
corsace-rebrand-2025.description: A comprehensive rebranding project to launch 2025 tournaments under new Corsace branding, symbolizing company transformation.
corsace-rebrand-2025.personalThoughts: I can't post a lot of about this just yet because I decided to make the call to postpone production until 2026 when the team feels more prepared. I'm personally excited to be more involved in the creative direction, it's crazy to think about how much I've grown since I started media with Corsace. I wen't from someone who knew almost 0 about design and media to a person who lives and breathes it. I'll update this project in 2026 once we reveal everything so stay tuned!

details.goal: Launch 2025 tournaments and projects under new Corsace branding to symbolize company transformation. Utilized After Effects, Photoshop, and Illustrator to create comprehensive tournament assets and establish new brand identity while respecting company history.

background.description: Corsace is a gaming company focused on osu!, hosting major community tournaments. Originally brought in as social media manager in 2020, I excelled in boosting social media impressions and created structure within the design team using agile methods.
points: Promoted to creative lead after successful social media management
Led design team to create tournament assets and creative projects
Company faced community drama and underwent major staff restructuring
Decided to rebrand to represent realignment with community-focused goals

preparation.description: Conducted meetings with head designer Kay starting in January to brainstorm rebranding approach.
points: Maintained similar clean, modern font style to avoid community whiplash
Preserved main color scheme (red for Corsace Open, yellow for Corsace Closed)
Incorporated elements from old logo to show evolution, not replacement
Focused on simple, fun, and exciting traits for the new brand identity

logo design.description: Collaborated on creating the new logo while respecting the decade-long history of the previous design.
points: Sketched flower designs using Illustrator's radial pattern tool
Settled on 5-petal sheared design for visual interest
Added rounded plus symbol as homage to previous logo's plus/dot elements
Revealed the rebrand publicly during "A Year in Mapping" project

asset creation.description: Oversaw creation of tournament assets and mascot design for Corsace Closed 2025.
points: Played overseer role, identifying design flaws and brand confusion risks
Drew inspiration from Zenless Zone Zero for street/tech aesthetic
Sketched mascot ideas and created mood boards for character design
Handled transition stingers and idle animations using After Effects

details.outcome: Community reception was mixed as expected - some enjoyed the new logo and rebranding attempts while others missed the historical design. Successfully made the creative branding jump and motivated the team to explore new design directions. Lead designer Kay praised my design growth and creative vision, noting tremendous improvement in skill and efficiency.

swiss-poster-miku-2024.title: Swiss Poster: Hatsune Miku
swiss-poster-miku-2024.description: A Swiss-style poster design featuring Hatsune Miku, blending modern tech aesthetics with classic design principles.
swiss-poster-miku-2024.personalThoughts: This project was like a puzzle and a game rolled into one. Taking inspiration from Valorant's tech style and applying it to a Swiss poster format taught me that I genuinely enjoy poster design. The process of learning the fundamentals, planning the composition, and experimenting with the layout was incredibly satisfying.

details.goal: To create a Swiss-style poster for the Hatsune Miku tour, combining modern tech aesthetics with traditional design principles

research.description: Dove into Swiss design fundamentals and studied modern tech aesthetics like Valorant's visual language.
points: Researched Swiss poster design principles and grid systems
Analyzed Valorant's UI and tech-forward visual style
Looked at successful tour posters for compositional ideas
Identified how to blend geometric precision with contemporary energy

planning.description: Sketched out multiple composition ideas to find the perfect balance.
points: Created rough layout sketches testing different grid systems
Planned hierarchy of information (artist name, tour dates, visual elements)
Decided on color palette inspired by Miku's iconic cyan
Mapped out where photo elements would intersect with typography

experimentation.description: Used Adobe InDesign and Photoshop to bring the vision to life.
points: Cropped and edited Miku photos in Photoshop for clean integration
Built precise grid system in InDesign for Swiss-style structure
Experimented with typography scale and weight relationships
Tested different geometric shape overlays for tech aesthetic
Iterated on color blocking to create visual interest

refinement.description: Polished the final design through careful adjustments.
points: Fine-tuned spacing and alignment for pixel-perfect precision
Adjusted contrast between background and foreground elements
Ensured readability while maintaining visual impact
Added final tech-inspired graphic elements

actions.task: Research Swiss design and modern tech aesthetics
Photo editing and preparation in Photoshop
Building layout and grid in InDesign
